page.title: 01RANBY AND BABWORTH PARISH
page.content: The block situated between Ranby to the east and Worksop to the west is mainly in the Parish of Babworth. Babworth is typical of the sand land parishes of West Nottinghamshire, being large in area (6344 acres), and dry. Its only natural water feature is the little River Ryton to the west of the A1. There has been no mining or industrial development and the block remains almost entirely agricultural. The village of Ranby is the only significant settlement. Outside Ranby the population tends to be grouped round the farms, which often provide accommodation for their workforce. The farms are large, the largest being 700 acres. Transport is a significant feature with the A1 running parallel to the old Great North Road.
